problem_text: Suppose α is an endomorphism of a group G such that for every group H and every homomorphism f : G → H, there exists an endomorphism βf of H such that βf f = f α. Must α then be either an inner automorphism of G or the trivial endomorphism? This is Question 5 in (G. M. Bergman, Publ. Matem., 56 (2012), 91–126). G. M. Bergman
